title: Running against an MLproject file located in a subdirectory of the directory failed
body:
### System information

- Linux Ubuntu 16.04)**:
- **MLflow installed from: pip
- **MLflow version: 1.0
- **Python version**: 3.6


### Describe the problem
As describing  in the document" To run against an MLproject file located in a subdirectory of the project, add a ‘#’ to the end of the URI argument, followed by the relative path from the project’s root directory to the subdirectory containing the desired project.".Moreover,the standard usage is "mlflow run git@github.com:mlflow/mlflow-example.git -P alpha=0.42". And the address of  my repository  is  "https://github.com/lyw615/quickstart.git",with a subdirectory  named 'sklearn_elasticnet_wine'. So the correct usage is "mlflow run https://github.com/lyw615/quickstart.git#/sklearn_elasticnet_wine/  -P alpha=0.42". However,the notification show :"mlflow.projects fetching projects from https://github.com/lyw615/quickstart.git#/sklearn_elasticnet_wine/  into  /tmp....", then consuming  long time,showing me "can't find the subdirectory "https://github.com/lyw615/quickstart.git#/sklearn_elasticnet_wine/"



### Source code / logs
Following is my command "mlflow run https://github.com/lyw615/quickstart.git#/sklearn_elasticnet_wine/  -P alpha=0.42".I just can't understand why the error shows even if i  followed the document.
